abstract: In a filing, Dell’s largest outside investor argues that the management-led buyout is too low and essentially robs shareholders. It is threatening to wage a campaign to kill the $24 billion deal.
snippet: In a filing, Dell’s largest outside investor argues that the management-led buyout is too low and essentially robs shareholders. It is threatening to wage a campaign to kill the $24 billion deal.
lead_paragraph: 7:44 p.m. | Updated One of the biggest investors in Dell said on Friday that it would oppose the company’s plans to go private, setting up a major potential roadblock for the biggest buyout since the financial crisis.

headline.main: Southeastern Asset Management to Fight Dell’s Takeover
headline.print_headline: Dell Investor Says Offer For Buyout Is Too Low

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
